item.title: 7 Days To Die: The Best Ways To Get Magazines
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Get Magazines Fast In 7 Days To Die
  • Alternate Methods For Finding Magazines

Magazines dictate what players can craft. They are a key part of progressing through 7 Days To Die. While there is an element of luck involved regarding which magazines the player finds, over time, the player will eventually get the magazines they need for their playstyle.

The world of 7 Days To Die is big â€” very big. From Navezgane to random gen worlds, each map has lots of places to explore, zombies to kill, and loot to bring home. There are several ways that players can pick up magazines. This article will cover the best and most efficient ways to gather magazines.

How To Get Magazines Fast In 7 Days To Die

While there are lots of ways that players can get magazines, looting mailboxes is by far the most efficient way of getting large quantities in a short space of time. Mailboxes have a much higher chance of containing magazines than most other containers in the game.

If you head to one of the game's towns or cities, you can just go street by street, looting mailboxes. Since you don't need to clear out any buildings in order to get them, even low-level players can do this with minimal risk.

For extra chances of finding magazines, it may be worth investing a couple of perk points in Lucky Looter further down the line to increase your chances of finding rare magazines. However, this perk increases your loot bonus percentage. For low-level players, the percentage boost is negligible. So, aside from being able to loot faster, the boost to your loot quality won't be very noticeable.

Alternate Methods For Finding Magazines

Mailboxes may be the most efficient way of getting lots of magazines easily, but there are lots of other ways that players can find and obtain them. For players who are well-armed, looting Crack-A-Book stores is a great way of finding lots of magazines. However, there will be a few dangerous enemies inside, so be prepared. Some of the other ways of finding magazines can be seen below:

  • Mission Rewards
  • Purchase From Traders
  • Enemy Loot Bags

Players will also find magazines in containers all over the map. While there's a chance to find a magazine or two in almost every type of container in the game, there are a few container types that have a higher chance of containing them. Players should keep an eye out for:

  • Bookcases
  • Book Piles
  • Desks
  • Filing Cabinets
  • Newspaper Dispensers

item.title: Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree - 5 Side Quests Players Should Not Skip
item.description:
Highlights

  • The Shadow of the Erdtree DLC offers new regions, weapons, and spells for Elden Ring players to explore and discover.
  • Completing NPC questlines like Moore's, Sir Ansbach's, and Hornsent's can lead to valuable rewards like armor sets and weapons.
  • Count Ymir's questline involves uncovering secrets in murky depths and ringing bells to obtain powerful items like the Maternal Staff.

With the release of the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC, FromSoftware unleashed a massive update to the Lands Between that could've been a sequel to Elden Ring in its own right. There's an entire new region to explore that's as deep as it is wide, with a plethora of weapons, spells and secrets just waiting for eager players to discover them.

Building on the base game's already expansive and intriguing lore, Shadow of the Erdtree continues the time-honored tradition of vague storytelling through cryptic item descriptions, carefully placed environmental hints, and important NPCs who talk a lot without saying much. Fans are by now familiar with having to put the pieces together themselves, and this is no more evident than in Elden Ring's quests. Nevertheless, below are some of the best new side quests players should try their best to seek out - the rewards are well worth it.

5 Moore

Mild-Mannered Merchant Just Wants Some Friends

  • Complete to obtain Forager Cookbooks and Moore's equipment.

Players can first encounter Moore outside Belurat, Tower Settlement in the Lands of Shadow. He's a gentle, softly spoken chap who just wants to sell items and look after his "friends". Kicking off his quest is as easy as tracking these "friends" down and collecting the various Forager Cookbooks from them - simple. But beware. These "friends" appear as the dreaded Kindred of Rot enemies from the base game, and Moore will invade the player if any of them are attacked.

After successfully collecting the books and the Black Syrup item, players should then hunt down Thiollier, then speak to Moore again after breaking Miquella's Charm. It's at this point that the Tarnished must make a choice that determines the outcome. But to obtain all the rewards - including Moore's armor set and hefty Verdigris Shield - it's recommended to have him invade after the events of Enir-Ilim.

4 Sir Ansbach

A Reliable Knight Till The Very End

  • Complete to obtain 2 weapons, 2 armor sets and an Incantation.

This former knight captain and his distinctive headgear can be first encountered at the Main Gate Cross site of grace, and interacts with another quest later on. Once Miquella's Charm has been broken, speak with Sir Ansbach at his first location and then again at the Storehouse, First Floor in the Shadow Keep. He'll ask for the Secret Rite Scroll - hand it over and continue the journey through the Lands of Shadow for now.

Once the Tarnished has completed the next few steps of Needle Knight Leda's quest, there should be a summon sign available back at the Shadow Keep Storehouse. After completing the objective, players will next have to join a battle against Miquella's followers where Sir Ansbach can be summoned. Speak to both him and Thiollier after the fight to enable them as summons for the final encounter, after which both will drop their weapons, armor sets, and an Incantation for the player to collect.

3 Hornsent

A Man On A Mission For Vengeance

  • Complete to obtain an Ash of War, a weapon and an armor set.

Hornsent is a mysterious and vengeful warrior the Tarnished can encounter at the Three-Path Cross site of grace. Once the player has spoken to him there, he can next be found at the Highroad Cross site of grace after defeating the Divine Beast Dancing Lion and obtaining some delicious(?) Scorpion Stew. He'll gratefully guzzle it down. After that, he'll be available as a summon against the Golden Hippopotamus outside the Shadow Keep Main Gate.

Head back to the Highroad Cross site of grace and speak with Needle Knight Leda. She'll ask whether she should hunt down Thiollier or Hornsent, but she'll always go after the latter no matter which choice is made, causing two summon signs to appear at the Shadow Keep. Choose the golden summon sign to aid Hornsent to obtain the Ash of War: Swift Slash and Leda's Rune. Next, summon him to help defeat Messmer, the Impaler and talk through all his dialogue to cause him to invade at the Church of the Bud, Main Entrance, where he'll drop the Falx, his armor set and a soiled loincloth (lovely).

2 Igon

Give A Dragon Slayer A Helping Hand

  • Complete to obtain his greatbow, armor set and Bell Bearing.

While adventuring west from the Pillar Path Waypoint, the Tarnished will hear Igon before they see him - he'll be screaming in pain about a dragon. Speak to him there before moving on and defeating the first Jagged Peak Drake, and then discover the Grand Alter of Dragon Communion. Slay two more Jagged Peak Drakes and report back to Igon to receive Igon's Furled Finger.

Next, players will have to defeat Ancient Dragin Senessax, which is very similar to Lansseax from the base game. Head up through the north exit and follow the trail of felled dragons to the top of Jagged Peak, using spiritsprings to climb higher. Squeeze through a small cave entrance to come face-to-face with Bayle the Dread. Igon's summon sign will appear somewhere in the arena, and he'll appear with some of the best dialogue in the entire game. When the big bad dragon is defeated, head back down the mountain and collect Igon's armor set, his greatbow and his Bell Bearing.

1 Count Ymir, High Priest

Uncover The Secrets Behind The Fingers

  • Complete to obtain the Maternal Staff, an armor set and a Bell Bearing.

When the Tarnished enters the murky depths of the Cathedral of Manus Metyr, they may speak with Count Ymir. From there, players will have to locate and ring the bell in the Finger Ruins of Rhia. Once that's done, head back to Count Ymir to obtain the Ruins Map (2nd) and venture onwards to Scaduview. There's another bell to ring in the Finger Ruins of Dheo, as well as the Ruins Map (3rd) to collect from Count Ymir.

Continue through the dungeon and locate the final bell in the Finger Ruins of Miyr. Players can then face Metyr, Mother of Fingers before traveling back to the Cathedral of Manus Metyr and interacting with the now empty throne, where they'll be invaded by the Swordhand of Night Jolan and also have to defeat Count Ymir, High Priest. After the battle, the Tarnished can collect the High Priest set, the Maternal Staff, and Ymir's Bell Bearing. Head out to the graveyard to find the Cherishing Fingers item to fully complete the quest.

item.title: The Garden Path: Where Is the Other Half of Augustus' Cutters (Secateurs)?
item.description:
As you meet more and more NPCs in The Garden Path , you'll find that each of them needs something during your game. One of these NPCs is named Augustus, and he will be one of the first NPCs you meet.

Augustus gives you a "knife," which is actually just half of a pair of sheers. If you want to be able to harvest most of the plant life in this farming game, you'll need these. But the other half of the sheers has been lost, and you may have some trouble finding it.

Where to Find Augustus in the Garden Path

There aren't any guaranteed places to find Augustus; he just kind of wanders around the forest. You may want to try looking to the east of the Community Centre; he may start off there during Day 1 or Day 2 of Spring in this cozy game. Once you find him, he will show up on the map as a white NPC bubble that you can scroll over. All NPCs that you have already met will show up on the map this way.

Where to Find the Other Half of the Secateurs

The other half of the sheers can be found in the Timber Coppice in this wholesome indie title, near the Community Centre. The map will have a big yellow circle in the general area where you have to look, but the thing you are looking for is very small and kind of blends in if you don't know exactly what it looks like. Above is a screenshot with the item circled in black to make it easier to spot.

As you can see, it is located west of the Community Centre where the decorative fork is. Look directly west of the Stash in this area, right by the stump. It's a little red thing on the ground. It's pretty easy to walk right over it and not even notice it since it's so small. Now that you have the other half, return to Augustus, and then ask him to put it back together again. He will get them working (barely), and give them back so you can now clip all sorts of items you haven't been able to up to this point. Use the right click or the Y button on a controller to open up the harvesting menu and press E or interact to use the sheers on whatever plant is under you.

The Garden Path is available now on PC and Switch.

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail â€“ Current Banner, Next Banner, And Past Banners
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Honkai: Star Rail Current Banners
  • Honkai: Star Rail Next Banners
  • Honkai: Star Rail Upcoming Banners
  • Honkai: Star Rail Banner History

Honkai: Star Rail shares many similarities with its predecessor, Genshin Impact . For instance, each version lasts for six weeks, and there are always two phases of the version, where each lasts for three weeks. When the three-week timer is over, players will see a change in the featured Warp Banner. Therefore, when a banner drops, Trailblazers have that much time to grind the game for every drop of Stellar Jade.

Players who are interested in knowing who's currently featured on the Warp Banner, who will be in the next banner, and who has been featured in the past banner, can check out this article. This piece also includes a complete Honkai: Star Rail banner history.

Honkai: Star Rail Current Banners

The current banners in Honkai: Star Rail 2.4 are Yunli (Physical - Destruction) and Huohuo (Wind - Abundance). Meanwhile, the four-star characters are Hanya (Physical - Harmony), Yukong (Imaginary - Harmony), and Lynx (Quantum - Abundance).

Version 2.4 (Phase 1): July 31, 2024 - August 21, 2024

Earth Hurled, Ether Curled

Bloom in Gloom

Dance at Sunset

Night of Fright

Honkai: Star Rail Next Banners

HSR next banners in Honkai: Star Rail 2.4 are Jiaoqiu and Sparkle .

Version 2.4 (Phase 2): August 21, 2024 - September 10, 2024

Jiaoqiu Debut/Sparkle First Rerun

Those Many Springs

Honkai: Star Rail Upcoming Banners

Honkai: Star Rail teased some characters that players may see in the future. Two of them, Feixiao and Lingsha, are confirmed for version 2.5.

Upcoming Banners

Version 2.5

Feixiao Debut

Lingsha Debut

Teased Characters

Feixiao

Moze

Huaiyan

Lingsha

March 7th

The other five characters that are teased are Feixiao, Moze, Huaiyan, Lingsha, and a Legendary New Swordmaster, which would be March 7th's Imaginary-Hunt form.

Honkai: Star Rail Banner History

Here's a full Honkai: Star Rail banner history, from the most recent to the oldest:

item.title: The Garden Path: What Does Releasing a Fish's Song Do?
item.description:
The Garden Path lets players pick up tons of plants, leaves, and tea ingredients, and they will also have to fish up a variety of marine life. While picking up these fish, you might notice that you have an option to release a fish's song.

If you are curious to learn what these fish songs can do when released, this guide is for you. It'll dive into which fish should be kept, which should be traded, and what fish are best to be released as songs in this farming simulation game.

How to Release Songs of Fish in the Garden Path

If you go into your inventory - using the I key on a keyboard or the menu button on a controller - you can scroll over all the fish in your inventory. Not all critters you can fish up have songs that you can release; frogs and other non-fish creatures don't have this ability. But if you scroll over an actual fish, you will be able to see what the song will do when released.

Press the interact button on a controller or E on a keyboard to use the fish's song. The game will ask if you are sure you want to release the fish's song, prompting you to press E again. Select "Yes," and the fish's song will change the immediate area around you. Sometimes, fish will plant seedlings of trees or bushes or flowers, but some fish can actually take you back to your house. Some of the fish you can catch with the fishing mechanics in this game can even carry tones inside them.

Should You Release Fish Songs or Keep Them in Garden Path?

While it might seem like a good idea to hold onto fish in case you need them in the future, most fish can be used at any time. Keeping a few to transport yourself back home after traveling across the map is a good idea, but planting trees and seeds around the garden is a better idea than trying to trade them. You will need more herbs and tea ingredients than you will need the fish, so don't be afraid to use them often.

How to Fish in the Garden Path

In order to release any fish songs in this cozy indie game, you will fish first. In order to get a fishing rod, you will need to find an NPC named Larto. He is found in the bottom right of the map in the little lake that is found down there. He will give you a fishing rod, and you can also trade plants for some of his fresh fish. Larto tends to carry rare fish and out-of-season fish to trade.

In order to fish, you need to equip your fishing rod, and then stand near a body of water. Press the interact button to start the fishing mini-game. Once in the game, you will see a little 2x2 square appear on the screen. Move the L stick around the 2x square until a colored circle appears. There will be three rings of circles; you need to stay in the bright red one in the center until the fish comes to your hook. Then you can press interact to put it into your inventory. Much like other similar games, different fish and critters appear during different times of the day and times of the year.

The Garden Path is available now on PC and Switch.
